>@Compendium[sfrpg.rules.Conditions]

>@Compendium[sfrpg.conditions.Dead] + @Compendium[sfrpg.conditions.Stable] + @Compendium[sfrpg.conditions.Unconscious]

A dying creature is @Compendium[sfrpg.conditions.Unconscious] and near death.

Creatures at 0 Hit Points that have not stabilized are dying.

A dying creature can take no actions and loses 1 Resolve Point each round at the end of its turn unless it is stabilized.

A dying creature can spend RP equal to one-quarter their maximum (minimum 1 RP, maximum 3 RP) to stabilize and can then spend another RP in a subsequent round to gain 1 Hit Point and stay in the fight.

Stabilizing or being healed above 0 Hit Points ends the dying condition, as does death.

See Injury and Death on page 250 for more information.
